main event: A witness observed an object in the sky over Dayton, Ohio that appeared to revolve and climb steadily to the east. The object was seen for 2-3 minutes.
interesting points: The object was reported to a regional operations center as an unidentified air vehicle.
No astronomical explanations were found for the observed object.
The object was tracked on ground radar, appearing to be 112 feet in diameter and making a series of sharp 90 degree turns before continuing on a straight course.
No visible aircraft or other object could be correlated with the radar target.
The case was closely studied but the object reported could not be positively identified.
photographs: no photographs included in the report
